competent.英释: having enough skill or knowledge to do something to a satisfactory standard

diversion.英释: a change in the direction or use of something, or the act of changing it

complaint.英释: a statement in which someone complains about something

priceless.中释: 无价的，难以用价格衡量的

evolution.英释: the gradual change and development of an idea, situation, or object

outnumber.英释: to be more in number than another group

fluctuate.英释: if a price or amount fluctuates, it keeps changing and becoming higher and lower

substance.英释: a particular type of solid, liquid, or gas

viewpoint.英释: a particular way of thinking about a problem or subject

imbalance.英释: a lack of a fair or correct balance between two things, which results in problems or unfairness

apartment.英释: a set of rooms on one floor of a large building, where someone lives

eliminate.英释: to completely get rid of something that is unnecessary or unwanted

affiliate.英释: if a group or organization affiliates to or with another larger one, it forms a close connection with it

memorable.英释: very good, enjoyable, or unusual, and worth remembering

violation.英释: an action that breaks a law, agreement, principle etc

transform.英释: to completely change the appearance, form, or character of something or someone, especially in a way that improves it

intervene.英释: to become involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens

recruiter.英释: someone in a company who is involved in recruiting new employees

undermine.英释: to gradually make someone or something less strong or effective

overstate.英释: to talk about something in a way that makes it seem more important, serious etc than it really is

obscurity.英释: the state of not being known or remembered

guarantee.英释: to promise to do something or to promise that something will happen

chronicle.英释: to describe events in the order in which they happened

milestone.英释: a very important event in the development of something

municipal.英释: relating to or belonging to the government of a town or city

affection.英释: a feeling of liking or love and caring

fascinate.英释: If something fascinates you, it interests and delights you so much that your thoughts tend to concentrate on it

injustice.英释: a situation in which people are treated very unfairly and not given their rights

democracy.英释: a situation or system in which everyone is equal and has the right to vote, make decisions etc

designate.英释: to choose someone or something for a particular job or purpose

expertise.英释: Expertise is special skill or knowledge that is acquired by training, study, or practice

ventilate.英释: to let fresh air into a room, building etc

turbulent.英释: a turbulent situation or period of time is one in which there are a lot of sudden changes

carpenter.英释: someone whose job is making and repairing wooden objects

modernize.英释: to make something such as a system or building more modern

character.英释: a person in a book, play, film etc

permanent.英释: continuing to exist for a long time or for all the time in the future

transcend.英释: to go beyond the usual limits of something

stabilize.英释: to become firm, steady, or unchanging, or to make something firm or steady

isolation.英释: when one group, person, or thing is separate from others

incidence.英释: the number of times something happens, especially crime, disease etc

interfere.英释: to deliberately get involved in a situation where you are not wanted or needed

glamorous.英释: attractive, exciting, and related to wealth and success

erroneous.英释: erroneous ideas or information are wrong and based on facts that are not correct

skeptical.英释: tending to disagree with what other people tell you

emphasize.英释: to say something in a strong way

reconcile.英释: if you reconcile two ideas, situations, or facts, you find a way in which they can both be true or acceptable

prescribe.英释: to say what medicine or treatment a sick person should have

hazardous.英释: dangerous, especially to people’s health or safety

objective.英释: something that you are trying hard to achieve, especially in business or politics

apologize.英释: to tell someone that you are sorry that you have done something wrong

disappear.英释: to become impossible to see any longer

justified.英释: having an acceptable explanation or reason

eccentric.英释: behaving in a way that is unusual and different from most people

principle.英释: a moral rule or belief about what is right and wrong, that influences how you behave

encourage.英释: to give someone the courage or confidence to do something

excessive.英释: much more than is reasonable or necessary

deficient.英释: not containing or having enough of something

recommend.英释: to say that something or someone is good, or suggest them for a particular purpose or job

cultivate.英释: to work hard to develop a particular skill, attitude, or quality

formulate.英释: to develop something such as a plan or a set of rules, and decide all the details of how it will be done

worldwide.英释: If something exists or happens worldwide, it exists or happens throughout the world

undecided.英释: not having made a decision about something important

publicity.英释: Publicity is information or actions that are intended to attract the public's attention to someone or something

incentive.英释: something that encourages you to work harder, start a new activity etc

prejudice.英释: an unreasonable dislike and distrust of people who are different from you in some way, especially because of their race, sex, religion etc – used to show disapproval

sculpture.英释: an object made out of stone, wood, clay etc by an artist

duplicate.英释: an exact copy of something that you can use in the same way

ecosystem.英释: all the animals and plants in a particular area, and the way in which they are related to each other and to their environment

skyrocket.英释: if a price or an amount skyrockets, it greatly increases very quickly

botanical.英释: relating to plants or the scientific study of plants

spectacle.英释: a very impressive show or scene

malicious.英释: very unkind and cruel, and deliberately behaving in a way that is likely to upset or hurt someone

inflation.英释: a continuing increase in prices, or the rate at which prices increase

criticism.英释: remarks that say what you think is bad about someone or something

outsource.英释: If a company outsources work or things, it pays workers from outside the company and often outside the country to do the work or supply the things

cognitive.英释: related to the process of knowing, understanding, and learning something

dishonest.英释: not honest, and so deceiving or cheating people

applicant.英释: someone who has formally asked, usually in writing, for a job, university place etc

counselor.英释: A counselor is a person whose job is to give advice to people who need it, especially advice on their personal problems.

potential.英释: the possibility that something will develop in a particular way, or have a particular effect

identical.英释: exactly the same, or very similar

immigrant.英释: someone who enters another country to live there permanently

integrity.英释: the quality of being honest and strong about what you believe to be right

expansion.英释: when a company, business etc becomes larger by opening new shops, factories etc

authority.英释: the power you have because of your official position

publicize.英释: to give information about something to the public, so that they know about it

hostility.英释: when someone is unfriendly and full of anger towards another person

ingenuity.英释: skill at inventing things and thinking of new ideas

tasteless.英释: food or drink that is tasteless is unpleasant because it has no particular taste

household.英释: all the people who live together in one house

auxiliary.英释: auxiliary workers provide additional help for another group of workers

regarding.英释: a word used especially in letters or speeches to introduce the subject you are writing or talking about

dimension.英释: the length, height, width, depth, or diameter of something

testimony.英释: a formal statement saying that something is true, especially one a  witness  makes in a court of law

eradicate.英释: to completely get rid of something such as a disease or a social problem

desperate.英释: willing to do anything to change a very bad situation, and not caring about danger

automatic.英释: an automatic machine is designed to work without needing someone to operate it for each part of a process

variation.英释: a difference between similar things, or a change from the usual amount or form of something

attendant.英释: someone whose job is to look after or help customers in a public place

redundant.中释: 失业的，被解雇的；过剩的
redundant.英释: if you are redundant, your employer no longer has a job for you

untreated.英释: harmful substances that are untreated have not been made safe

mortality.英释: the number of deaths during a particular period of time among a particular type or group of people

attribute.英释: If you attribute something to an event or situation, you think that it was caused by that event or situation

cafeteria.英释: a restaurant, often in a factory, college etc, where you choose from foods that have already been cooked and carry your own food to a table

threshold.英释: the entrance to a room or building, or the area of floor or ground at the entrance

athletics.英释: sports such as running and jumping

available.英释: something that is available is able to be used or can easily be bought or found

consensus.英释: an opinion that everyone in a group agrees with or accepts

adversity.英释: a situation in which you have a lot of problems that seem to be caused by bad luck

rewarding.英释: making you feel happy and satisfied because you feel you are doing something useful or important, even if you do not earn much money

carpentry.英释: the skill or work of a carpenter

intrinsic.英释: being part of the nature or character of someone or something

diligence.英释: careful and thorough work or effort

fertility.英释: the ability of the land or soil to produce good crops

reception.英释: a particular type of welcome for someone, or a particular type of reaction to their ideas, work etc

visualize.英释: to form a picture of someone or something in your mind

precision.英释: the quality of being very exact or correct

promotion.英释: an activity intended to help sell a product, or the product that is being promoted

adventure.英释: an exciting experience in which dangerous or unusual things happen

renewable.英释: renewable energy replaces itself naturally, or is easily replaced because there is a large supply of it

immersive.英释: providing information or stimulation for a number of senses, not only sight and sound

primitive.英释: belonging to a simple way of life that existed in the past and does not have modern industries and machines

frustrate.英释: if something frustrates you, it makes you feel annoyed or angry because you are unable to do what you want

abolition.英释: when a law or a system is officially ended

detective.英释: a police officer whose job is to discover information about crimes and catch criminals

rebellion.英释: an organized attempt to change the government or leader of a country, using violence

reinforce.英释: to give support to an opinion, idea, or feeling, and make it stronger

diversity.英释: the fact of including many different types of people or things

awareness.英释: knowledge or understanding of a particular subject or situation

mechanism.英释: a system that is intended to achieve something or deal with a problem

interpret.英释: to translate spoken words from one language into another

intuitive.英释: an intuitive idea is based on a feeling rather than on knowledge or facts

pragmatic.英释: dealing with problems in a sensible practical way instead of strictly following a set of ideas

alleviate.英释: to make something less painful or difficult to deal with

procedure.英释: a way of doing something, especially the correct or usual way

aggravate.英释: to make a bad situation, an illness, or an injury worse

liability.英释: legal responsibility for something, especially for paying money that is owed, or for damage or injury

executive.英释: a group of people who are in charge of an organization and make the rules

allegedly.英释: used when reporting something that people say is true, although it has not been proved

defensive.英释: used or intended to protect someone or something against attack

migration.英释: the movement of large numbers of people, birds or animals from one place to another

practical.英释: relating to real situations and events rather than ideas, emotions etc

territory.英释: land that is owned or controlled by a particular country, ruler, or military force

privilege.英释: a special advantage that is given only to one person or group of people

deduction.英释: the process of taking away an amount from a total, or the amount that is taken away

precedent.英释: an action or official decision that can be used to give support to later actions or decisions

pessimist.英释: someone who always expects that bad things will happen

encounter.英释: to experience something, especially problems or opposition

institute.英释: an organization that has a particular purpose such as scientific or educational work, or the building where this organization is based

undertake.英释: to accept that you are responsible for a piece of work, and start to do it

commodity.英释: a product that is bought and sold

stimulate.英释: to encourage or help an activity to begin or develop further

biography.英释: a book that tells what has happened in someone’s life, written by someone else

resultant.英释: happening or existing because of something

bourgeois.中释: 中产阶级的；庸俗的；资产阶级的

jewellery.英释: small things that you wear for decoration, such as rings or necklaces

perimeter.英释: the border around an enclosed area such as a military camp

fabricate.英释: to invent a story, piece of information etc in order to deceive someone

volunteer.英释: to offer to do something without expecting any reward, often something that other people do not want to do

conqueror.英释: The conquerors of a country or group of people are the people who have taken complete control of that country or group's land

sincerity.英释: when someone is sincere and really means what they are saying

literally.英释: according to the most basic or original meaning of a word or expression

hindrance.英释: something or someone that makes it difficult for you to do something

alongside.英释: next to the side of something

operation.英释: an action done by a computer

prototype.英释: the first form that a new design of a car, machine etc has, or a model of it used to test the design before it is produced

senseless.英释: happening or done for no good reason or with no purpose

amusement.英释: the feeling you have when you think something is funny

ambitious.英释: determined to be successful, rich, powerful etc

courteous.英释: polite and showing respect for other people

postulate.英释: to suggest that something might have happened or be true

narration.英释: the act of telling a story

requisite.英释: something that you need for a particular purpose

directory.英释: a book or list of names, facts etc, usually arranged in alphabetical order

paragraph.英释: part of a piece of writing which starts on a new line and contains at least one sentence

uniformly.英释: not varying; the same in all parts and at all times

inversely.英释: opposite in amount or position to sth else

realistic.英释: judging and dealing with situations in a practical way according to what is actually possible rather than what you would like to happen

ignorance.英释: lack of knowledge or information about something

doubtless.英释: used when saying that something is almost certain to happen or be true

inorganic.英释: not consisting of anything that is living

enclosure.英释: an area surrounded by a wall or fence, and used for a particular purpose

catalogue.英释: to make a complete list of all the things in a group

microwave.英释: a very short electric wave that is used in cooking food and sending messages by radio, and in radar

inference.英释: something that you think is true, based on information that you have

overthrow.英释: the defeat and removal from power of a leader or government, especially by force

projector.英释: a piece of equipment that makes a film or picture appear on a screen or flat surface

accessory.英释: not the most important when compared to others

advertise.英释: to tell the public about a product or service in order to persuade them to buy it

customary.英释: something that is customary is normal because it is the way something is usually done

sweetness.英释: how sweet something tastes or smells

astronomy.英释: the scientific study of the stars and  planet s

introduce.英释: to formally present a possible new law to be discussed

negotiate.英释: to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

shorthand.英释: a fast method of writing using special signs or shorter forms to represent letters, words, and phrases

speculate.英释: to guess about the possible causes or effects of something, without knowing all the facts or details

treasurer.英释: someone who is officially responsible for the money for an organization, club, political party etc

momentary.英释: continuing for a very short time

hydraulic.英释: moved or operated by the pressure of water or other liquid

dependant.英释: someone, especially a child, who depends on you for food, clothes, money etc

influence.英释: the power to make other people agree with your opinions or do what you want

evaporate.英释: if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas

lubricate.英释: to put a lubricant on something in order to make it move more smoothly

integrate.英释: to combine two or more things so that they work together; to combine with sth else in this way

alternate.英释: (of two things) happening or following one after the other regularly

embarrass.英释: to cause problems or difficulties for sb

establish.英释: to make people accept that you can do something, or that you have a particular quality

execution.英释: a process in which you do something that has been carefully planned

whitewash.英释: to hide the true facts about a serious accident or illegal action

limestone.英释: a type of rock that contains calcium

remainder.英释: the part of something that is left after everything else has gone or been dealt with

editorial.英释: a piece of writing in a newspaper that gives the editor’s opinion about something, rather than reporting facts

sociology.英释: the scientific study of societies and the behaviour of people in groups

tradesman.英释: someone who buys and sells goods or services, especially in a shop

underwear.英释: clothes that you wear next to your body under your other clothes

personnel.英释: the department in a company that chooses people for jobs and deals with their complaints, problems etc

certainty.英释: the fact that something is certain to happen

dissipate.英释: to gradually become less or weaker before disappearing completely, or to make something do this

spherical.英释: having the shape of a sphere

barometer.英释: an instrument that measures changes in the air pressure and the weather, or that calculates height above sea level

enlighten.英释: to give someone more knowledge and greater understanding about something

persecute.英释: to treat someone cruelly or unfairly over a period of time, especially because of their religious or political beliefs

frequency.英释: the fact that something happens a lot

difficult.英释: someone who is difficult never seems pleased or satisfied

masculine.英释: having qualities considered to be typical of men or of what men do

endurance.英释: the ability to continue doing something difficult or painful over a long period of time

ambiguous.英释: that can be understood in more than one way; having different meanings

decidedly.英释: in a way that shows that you are very sure about a decision

offensive.英释: very rude or insulting and likely to upset people

propeller.英释: a piece of equipment consisting of two or more blades that spin around, which makes an aircraft or ship move

prevalent.英释: common at a particular time, in a particular place, or among a particular group of people

otherwise.英释: except for what has just been mentioned

historian.英释: a person who studies or writes about history; an expert in history

mechanics.英释: the part of physics that deals with the natural forces that act on moving or stationary objects

intellect.英释: the ability to understand things and to think intelligently

excursion.英释: a short journey arranged so that a group of people can visit a place, especially while they are on holiday

terrorist.英释: someone who uses violence such as bombing, shooting etc to obtain political demands

sovereign.英释: having the highest power in a country

hurricane.英释: a storm that has very strong fast winds and that moves over water

exemplify.英释: to give an example of something

rectangle.英释: a shape that has four straight sides, two of which are usually longer than the other two, and four 90˚ angles at the corners

induction.英释: the introduction of someone into a new job, company, official position etc, or the ceremony at which this is done

symposium.英释: a formal meeting in which people who know a lot about a particular subject have discussions about it

selection.英释: the careful choice of a particular person or thing from a group of similar people or things

empirical.英释: based on scientific testing or practical experience, not on ideas

longitude.英释: the distance of a place east or west of the Greenwich meridian, measured in degrees

economics.英释: the study of the way in which money and goods are produced and used

interview.英释: an official meeting with someone who asks you questions

parachute.英释: a piece of equipment fastened to the back of people who jump out of planes, which makes them fall slowly and safely to the ground

discourse.英释: a serious speech or piece of writing on a particular subject

architect.英释: someone whose job is to design buildings

inspector.英释: an official whose job is to check that something is satisfactory and that rules are being obeyed

challenge.英释: a new or difficult task that tests sb's ability and skill

stability.英释: the condition of being steady and not changing

insistent.英释: demanding firmly and repeatedly that something should happen

persevere.英释: to continue trying to do something in a very determined way in spite of difficulties – use this to show approval

stillness.英释: the quality of being quiet and not moving

successor.英释: someone who takes a job or position previously held by someone else

quarterly.英释: produced or happening four times a year

gathering.英释: a meeting of a group of people

energetic.英释: having or needing a lot of energy or determination

ingenious.英释: (of an object, a plan, an idea, etc.) very suitable for a particular purpose and resulting from clever new ideas

framework.英释: a set of ideas, rules, or beliefs from which something is developed, or on which decisions are based

correlate.英释: either of two things that correlate with each other

composite.英释: something made up of different parts or materials

synthesis.中释: 综合，综合物；（化学或生物学物质的）合成；（用电子方式对声音、语音或音乐的）合成
synthesis.英释: something that has been made by combining different things, or the process of combining things

aerospace.英释: the industry that designs and builds aircraft and space vehicles

provision.英释: a condition in an agreement or law

amplitude.英释: the distance between the middle and the top or bottom of a wave such as a sound wave

orchestra.英释: a large group of musicians playing many different kinds of instruments and led by a conductor

obstinate.英释: determined not to change your ideas, behaviour, opinions etc, even when other people think you are being unreasonable

agitation.英释: public argument or action for social or political change

impartial.英释: not involved in a particular situation, and therefore able to give a fair opinion or piece of advice

implement.英释: to take action or make changes that you have officially decided should happen

workpiece.英释: a piece of metal or other material that is in the process of being worked on or made or has actually been cut or shaped by a hand tool or machine

vaccinate.英释: to protect a person or animal from a disease by giving them a vaccine

insulator.英释: a material or object which does not allow electricity, heat, or sound to pass through it

elevation.英释: the height of a place, especially its height above sea level

sentiment.英释: a feeling or an opinion, especially one based on emotions

sensation.英释: a feeling that you get from one of your five senses, especially the sense of touch

satellite.英释: a country, area, or organization that is controlled by or is dependent on another larger one

corrosion.英释: the gradual destruction of metal by the effect of water, chemicals etc or a substance such as rust produced by this process

obedience.英释: when someone does what they are told to do, or what a law, rule etc says they must do

pineapple.英释: a large yellow-brown tropical fruit or its sweet juicy yellow flesh

landscape.英释: an area of countryside or land of a particular type, used especially when talking about its appearance

partition.英释: the action of separating a country into two or more independent countries

interface.英释: the way in which you see the information from a computer program on a screen, or how you type information into the program

reproduce.英释: to make a copy of a picture, piece of text, etc.

propagate.英释: to spread an idea, belief etc to many people

originate.英释: to come from a particular place or start in a particular situation

spokesman.英释: a man who has been chosen to speak officially for a group, organization, or government

offspring.英释: someone’s child or children – often used humorously

alignment.英释: the state of being arranged in a line with something or parallel to something

subscribe.英释: to pay money, usually once a year, to have copies of a newspaper or magazine sent to you, or to have some other service

capacitor.英释: a piece of equipment that collects and stores electricity

electrode.英释: a small piece of metal or a wire that is used to send electricity through a system or through a person’s body

cartridge.英释: a tube containing explosive powder and a bullet that you put in a gun

magnitude.英释: the great size or importance of something

multitude.英释: a very large number of people or things

magnetism.英释: the physical force that makes two metal objects pull towards each other or push each other apart

stainless.英释: resistant to discoloration, esp discoloration resulting from corrosion; rust-resistant

shipwreck.英释: the destruction of a ship in an accident

notorious.英释: famous or well-known for something bad

warehouse.英释: a large building for storing large quantities of goods

reference.英释: a book, article etc from which information has been obtained

spectator.英释: someone who is watching an event or game

parameter.英释: a set of fixed limits that control the way that something should be done

disregard.英释: when someone ignores something that they should not ignore

seemingly.英释: appearing to have a particular quality, when this may or may not be true

criterion.英释: a standard that you use to judge something or make a decision about something

fireplace.英释: a special place in the wall of a room, where you can make a fire

breakdown.英释: a failure of a relationship, discussion or system

deviation.英释: a noticeable difference from what is expected or acceptable

vengeance.英释: a violent or harmful action that someone does to punish someone for harming them or their family

assurance.英释: a promise that something will definitely happen or is definitely true, made especially to make someone less worried

safeguard.英释: a rule, agreement etc that is intended to protect someone or something from possible dangers or problems

inclusive.英释: an inclusive price or cost includes everything

subdivide.英释: to divide into smaller parts something that is already divided

patriotic.英释: having or expressing a great love of your country

immigrate.英释: to come into a country in order to live there permanently

unanimous.英释: a unanimous decision, vote, agreement etc is one in which all the people involved agree

situation.英释: the type of area where a building is situated - used especially by people who sell or advertise buildings

decompose.英释: to decay or make something decay

supervise.英释: to be in charge of an activity or person, and make sure that things are done in the correct way

terminate.英释: ito end; to make sth end

slaughter.英释: when large numbers of people are killed in a cruel or violent way

allowance.英释: an amount of money that you are given regularly or for a special purpose
